content.raw: It should work on windows! It doesn't need a c compiler or anything. The only difference should be how the building code finds the pyrcc5 and pyrcc4 executables. And actually it's quite possible that I originally made the code on Windows, since I was on a windows machine at NIST back then. So if something is not working there it shouldn't be too hard to fix.
content.html: It should work on windows! It doesn't need a c compiler or anything. The only difference should be how the building code finds the pyrcc5 and pyrcc4 executables. And actually it's quite possible that I originally made the code on Windows, since I was on a windows machine at NIST back then. So if something is not working there it shouldn't be too hard to fix.
